lead_paragraph: A TWENTY-TWO CAR special train loaded with wounded British soldiers sped from Germany through Switzerland and down across France last week. It came to a stop at a southern French seaport. German officers in charge and British officers waiting traded stiff military greetings and the first war captives to be exchanged since the war began two years ago were formally transferred from Germany to England.
